title: Special Purpose visa
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== Special Purpose visa This is a temporary visa that lets you enter and stay in Australia while you hold your prescribed status. You do not apply for this visa. It is granted automatically to people who have a 'prescribed status'. Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview About this visa Eligibility Step by step When you have this visa Overview Stay You can stay in Australia temporarily for as long as you have a 'prescribed status', unless we cease your visa for another reason. If you are an airline crew member, aircraft safety inspector or airline positioning crew member see Crew Travel Authority. Cost There is no application fee for this visa. Processing times There are no processing times available for this visa. With this temporary visa, depending on your prescribed status, you can enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status undertake your regular work while in Australia as part of your military duties arrive as an airline crew member, or join a flight as a member of crew. See Crew Travel Authority for the work conditons See all conditions Check your eligibility You must have a 'prescribed status'. This includes but is not limited to being: a member of certain foreign armed forces a person on board a ship of a foreign armed forces an airline, or airline positioning crew member the accompanying spouse or dependant of an eligible person with a prescribed status About this visa With this visa you can, depending on your prescribed status How long you can stay Stay longer Include family Cost Your obligations Health insurance Travel Visa label With this visa you can, depending on your prescribed status enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status undertake your regular work while in Australia as part of your military duties arrive as an airline crew member, or join a flight as a member of crew. See Crew Travel Authority for the work conditions How long you can stay You can stay in Australia on a temporary basis for as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. Your visa will cease if: your prescribed status ends, or we cease your visa Stay longer Your visa will cease if your 'prescribed status' ends. If you want to stay longer in Australia you must apply for a different visa. Explore your visa options Include family In some limited circumstances, your partner or dependent relative may be eligible for a Special Purpose visa. Find out about eligibility Cost There is no application charge for this visa. Your obligations The Special Purpose visa is only valid as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. If your prescribed status ends, the visa will cease. You must obey all Australian laws. You must comply with all legal obligations attached to your prescribed status. Health insurance We recommend you take out health insurance to cover any unforeseen medical treatment you might need in Australia. You are personally liable for all your healthcare costs while you are in Australia. Insurance can help limit your financial liability. See what we consider adequate health insurance Learn more about health insurance for overseas visitors Reciprocal healthcare agreements Some countries have a reciprocal healthcare agreement with Australia. Find out more from Services Australia about reciprocal healthcare agreements Travel You can enter and depart Australia as many times as you want as long as you hold the prescribed status. Visa label As this temporary visa is based on your prescribed status it may not be linked to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport. Eligibility Have a 'prescribed status' To have a prescribed status, this includes but is not limited to being: An airline crew member You must be an: airline crew member airline positioning crew member aircraft safety inspector For more information, visit: Crew Travel Authority A person on board a ship of foreign armed forces You must be: a person who forms part of the complement of a ship of the regular armed forces of a foreign government and on board the ship when it enters Australia A member of certain foreign armed forces You must be a member of: the military or civilian component of the armed forces of a country that has a Status of Forces Agreement with Australia the armed forces of a specified Asia-Pacific country, travelling to Australia or in Australia as part of your duty the armed forces of a specified Commonwealth country, travelling to Australia or in Australia as part of your duty You are also eligible if you are the accompanying spouse, de facto partner or dependent relative of an eligible armed forces member and are listed on the members military travel orders. Members of the armed forces of Canada, Singapore, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, and the United States of America may be eligible to be registered for the Special Purpose Travel Authority (subclass 945) (SPTA). In limited circumstances the SPTA provides a visa grant number (VGN) to eligible military members and their dependents. Eligible military members and their dependents can use the VGN in VEVO to show their status to employers, education providers and other Australian organisations. Military personnel and their dependents should contact their High Commission, Embassy or Defence representative for advice on their visa status. For more information, visit: Military personnel travelling with restricted goods Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our step by step guide. Step by step Step 1 You can't apply for this visa. We automatically grant this visa when you enter Australia. When you have this visa Coming to Australia In Australia Leaving Australia Coming to Australia Before you leave You must have a valid passport or other travel document. Military personnel must travel with Military ID and Movement orders indicating their travel to Australia. Dependants must travel with their valid national passport and a certificate or letter stating that they are a dependant of the primary Military person. Airline Crew must hold a valid passport and Airline Identity Card and be included on the crew list, or carry a letter from their employer indicating the purpose of travel as airline positioning crew. At the border We will grant you the Special Purpose visa when you enter Australia. In Australia What you must do on your visa The Special Purpose visa is a temporary visa that is only valid as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. If your prescribed status ends, the visa will cease. You must follow all Australian laws. You must comply with all legal obligations attached to your eligibility status. What you can do on your visa The Special Purpose visa lets you: enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status undertake your regular work as part of your military duties while you are in Australia arrive as an airline crew member, positioning crew member or aircraft safety inspector If you are a spouse, de facto partner or dependent relative of an eligible armed forces member, and listed on the travel orders as accompanying them to Australia, you are able to work and study while in Australia. If you are an airline crew member, airline positioning crew member or an aircraft safety inspector, see Crew Travel Authority Staying longer Your visa will cease if your 'prescribed status' ends. If you want to stay longer in Australia you must apply for a different visa. Explore your visa options Leaving Australia Before you leave You must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia. After you leave Request your international movement records to get proof of your travel in and out of Australia.
main_content:
===== main placeholder ==========================================

# Special Purpose visa

Special Purpose visa

This is a temporary visa that lets you enter and stay in Australia while you hold your prescribed status. You do not apply for this visa. It is granted automatically to people who have a 'prescribed status'.

This is a temporary visa that lets you enter and stay in Australia while you hold your prescribed status. You do not apply for this visa. It is granted automatically to people who have a 'prescribed status'.

This is a temporary visa that lets you enter and stay in Australia while you hold your prescribed status. You do not apply for this visa. It is granted automatically to people who have a 'prescribed status'.
- Overview
Overview
- About this visa
About this visa
- Eligibility
Eligibility
- Step by step
Step by step
- When you have this visa
When you have this visa
Overview
About this visa
Eligibility
Step by step
When you have this visa
Overview

#### Stay

Stay

You can stay in Australia temporarily for as long as you have a 'prescribed status', unless we cease your visa for another reason.

You can stay in Australia temporarily for as long as you have a 'prescribed status', unless we cease your visa for another reason.

If you are an airline crew member, aircraft safety inspector or airline positioning crew member seeCrew Travel Authority.

If you are an airline crew member, aircraft safety inspector or airline positioning crew member see
Crew Travel Authority.

#### Cost

Cost

There is no application fee for this visa.

There is no application fee for this visa.

#### Processing times

Processing times

There are no processing times available for this visa.

There are no processing times available for this visa.

#### With this temporary visa, depending on your prescribed status, you can

With this temporary visa, depending on your prescribed status, you can
- enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status
enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status
- undertake your regular work while in Australia as part of your military duties
undertake your regular work while in Australia as part of your military duties
- arrive as an airline crew member, or join a flight as a member of crew. SeeCrew Travel Authorityfor the work conditons
arrive as an airline crew member, or join a flight as a member of crew. See
Crew Travel Authority
for the work conditons

See all conditions

See all conditions

Check your eligibility

Check your eligibility

#### You must

You must

have a 'prescribed status'. This includes but is not limited to being:

have a 'prescribed status'. This includes but is not limited to being:
- a member of certain foreign armed forces
a member of certain foreign armed forces
- a person on board a ship of a foreign armed forces
a person on board a ship of a foreign armed forces
- an airline, or airline positioning crew member
an airline, or airline positioning crew member
- the accompanying spouse or dependant of an eligible person with a prescribed status
the accompanying spouse or dependant of an eligible person with a prescribed status
About this visa
With this visa you can, depending on your prescribed status
How long you can stay
Stay longer
Include family
Cost
Your obligations
Health insurance
Travel
Visa label

## With this visa you can, depending on your prescribed status

With this visa you can, depending on your prescribed status
- enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status
enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status
- undertake your regular work while in Australia as part of your military duties
undertake your regular work while in Australia as part of your military duties
- arrive as an airline crew member, or join a flight as a member of crew. SeeCrew Travel Authorityfor the work conditions
arrive as an airline crew member, or join a flight as a member of crew. See
Crew Travel Authority
for the work conditions

## How long you can stay

How long you can stay

You can stay in Australia on a temporary basis for as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. Your visa will cease if:

You can stay in Australia on a temporary basis for as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. Your visa will cease if:
- your prescribed status ends, or
your prescribed status ends, or
- we cease your visa
we cease your visa

## Stay longer

Stay longer

Your visa will cease if your 'prescribed status' ends. If you want to stay longer in Australia you must apply for a different visa.

Your visa will cease if your 'prescribed status' ends. If you want to stay longer in Australia you must apply for a different visa.

Explore your visa options.

Explore your visa options
.

## Include family

Include family

In some limited circumstances, your partner or dependent relative may be eligible for a Special Purpose visa. Find out abouteligibility.

In some limited circumstances, your partner or dependent relative may be eligible for a Special Purpose visa. Find out about
eligibility
.

## Cost

Cost

There is no application charge for this visa.

There is no application charge for this visa.

## Your obligations

Your obligations

The Special Purpose visa is only valid as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. If your prescribed status ends, the visa will cease.

The Special Purpose visa is only valid as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. If your prescribed status ends, the visa will cease.

You must obey all Australian laws.

You must obey all Australian laws.

You must comply with all legal obligations attached to your prescribed status.

You must comply with all legal obligations attached to your prescribed status.

## Health insurance

Health insurance

We recommend you take out health insurance to cover any unforeseen medical treatment you might need in Australia. You are personally liable for all your healthcare costs while you are in Australia. Insurance can help limit your financial liability.

We recommend you take out health insurance to cover any unforeseen medical treatment you might need in Australia. You are personally liable for all your healthcare costs while you are in Australia. Insurance can help limit your financial liability.

See what we consideradequate health insurance.

See what we consider
adequate health insurance
.

Learn more abouthealth insurance for overseas visitors.

Learn more about
health insurance for overseas visitors
.

### Reciprocal healthcare agreements

Reciprocal healthcare agreements

Some countries have a reciprocal healthcare agreement with Australia. Find out more from Services Australia aboutreciprocal healthcare agreements.

Some countries have a reciprocal healthcare agreement with Australia. Find out more from Services Australia about
reciprocal healthcare agreements
.

## Travel

Travel

You can enter and depart Australia as many times as you want as long as you hold the prescribed status.

You can enter and depart Australia as many times as you want as long as you hold the prescribed status.

## Visa label

Visa label

As this temporary visa is based on your prescribed status it may not be linked to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport.

As this temporary visa is based on your prescribed status it may not be linked to your passport. You will not get a label in your passport.
Eligibility

## Have a 'prescribed status'

Have a 'prescribed status'

To have a prescribed status, this includes but is not limited to being:

To have a prescribed status, this includes but is not limited to being:

### An airline crew member

An airline crew member

You must be an:

You must be an:
- airline crew member
airline crew member
- airline positioning crew member
airline positioning crew member
- aircraft safety inspector
aircraft safety inspector

For more information, visit:Crew Travel Authority

For more information, visit:
Crew Travel Authority

### A person on board a ship of foreign armed forces

A person on board a ship of foreign armed forces

You must be:

You must be:
- a person who forms part of the complement of a ship of the regular armed forces of a foreign government and
a person who forms part of the complement of a ship of the regular armed forces of a foreign government and
- on board the ship when it enters Australia
on board the ship when it enters Australia

### A member of certain foreign armed forces

A member of certain foreign armed forces

You must be a member of:

You must be a member of:
- the military or civilian component of the armed forces of a country that has a Status of Forces Agreement with Australia
the military or civilian component of the armed forces of a country that has a Status of Forces Agreement with Australia
- the armed forces of a specified Asia-Pacific country, travelling to Australia or in Australia as part of your duty
the armed forces of a specified Asia-Pacific country, travelling to Australia or in Australia as part of your duty
- the armed forces of a specified Commonwealth country, travelling to Australia or in Australia as part of your duty
the armed forces of a specified Commonwealth country, travelling to Australia or in Australia as part of your duty

You are also eligible if you are the accompanying spouse, de facto partner or dependent relative of an eligible armed forces member and are listed on the members military travel orders.

You are also eligible if you are the accompanying spouse, de facto partner or dependent relative of an eligible armed forces member and are listed on the members military travel orders.

Members of the armed forces of Canada, Singapore, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, and the United States of America may be eligible to be registered for the Special Purpose Travel Authority (subclass 945) (SPTA).

Members of the armed forces of Canada, Singapore, the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, and the United States of America may be eligible to be registered for the Special Purpose Travel Authority (subclass 945) (SPTA).

In limited circumstances the SPTA provides a visa grant number (VGN) to eligible military members and their dependents. Eligible military members and their dependents can use the VGN inVEVOto show their status to employers, education providers and other Australian organisations.

In limited circumstances the SPTA provides a visa grant number (VGN) to eligible military members and their dependents. Eligible military members and their dependents can use the VGN in
VEVO
to show their status to employers, education providers and other Australian organisations.

Military personnel and their dependents should contact their High Commission, Embassy or Defence representative for advice on their visa status.

Military personnel and their dependents should contact their High Commission, Embassy or Defence representative for advice on their visa status.

For more information, visit:Military personnel travelling with restricted goods

For more information, visit:
Military personnel travelling with restricted goods

Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in ourstep by stepguide.

Meet all these criteria? Check how to apply in our
step by step
guide.
Step by step

Step 1

Step 1
You can't apply for this visa. We automatically grant this visa when you enter Australia.
When you have this visa
Coming to Australia
In Australia
Leaving Australia

## Coming to Australia

Coming to Australia

### Before you leave

Before you leave

You must have a valid passport or other travel document.

You must have a valid passport or other travel document.

Military personnel must travel with Military ID and Movement orders indicating their travel to Australia. Dependants must travel with their valid national passport and a certificate or letter stating that they are a dependant of the primary Military person.

Military personnel must travel with Military ID and Movement orders indicating their travel to Australia. Dependants must travel with their valid national passport and a certificate or letter stating that they are a dependant of the primary Military person.

Airline Crew must hold a valid passport and Airline Identity Card and be included on the crew list, or carry a letter from their employer indicating the purpose of travel as airline positioning crew.

Airline Crew must hold a valid passport and Airline Identity Card and be included on the crew list, or carry a letter from their employer indicating the purpose of travel as airline positioning crew.

### At the border

At the border

We will grant you the Special Purpose visa when you enter Australia.

We will grant you the Special Purpose visa when you enter Australia.

## In Australia

In Australia

### What you must do on your visa

What you must do on your visa

The Special Purpose visa is a temporary visa that is only valid as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. If your prescribed status ends, the visa will cease.

The Special Purpose visa is a temporary visa that is only valid as long as you have a 'prescribed status'. If your prescribed status ends, the visa will cease.

You must follow all Australian laws.

You must follow all Australian laws.

You must comply with all legal obligations attached to your eligibility status.

You must comply with all legal obligations attached to your eligibility status.

### What you can do on your visa

What you can do on your visa

The Special Purpose visa lets you:

The Special Purpose visa lets you:
- enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status
enter and stay in Australia temporarily, while you hold the prescribed status
- undertake your regular work as part of your military duties while you are in Australia
undertake your regular work as part of your military duties while you are in Australia
- arrive as an airline crew member, positioning crew member or aircraft safety inspector
arrive as an airline crew member, positioning crew member or aircraft safety inspector

If you are a spouse, de facto partner or dependent relative of an eligible armed forces member, and listed on the travel orders as accompanying them to Australia, you are able to work and study while in Australia.

If you are a spouse, de facto partner or dependent relative of an eligible armed forces member, and listed on the travel orders as accompanying them to Australia, you are able to work and study while in Australia.

If you are an airline crew member, airline positioning crew member or an aircraft safety inspector, seeCrew Travel Authority

If you are an airline crew member, airline positioning crew member or an aircraft safety inspector, see
Crew Travel Authority

### Staying longer

Staying longer

Your visa will cease if your 'prescribed status' ends. If you want to stay longer in Australia you must apply for a different visa.

Your visa will cease if your 'prescribed status' ends. If you want to stay longer in Australia you must apply for a different visa.

Explore your visa options.

Explore your visa options
.

## Leaving Australia

Leaving Australia

### Before you leave

Before you leave

You must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia.

You must have a valid passport or other travel document to leave Australia.

### After you leave

After you leave

Request your international movement recordsto get proof of your travel in and out of Australia.

Request your international movement records
to get proof of your travel in and out of Australia.
